DataElement.preferredName: Patient Histologic Confirmation NSCLC EGFR Activating Mutation Prior Therapy Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the histologic verification of non-small cell lung carcinoma, mutations of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene, prior administration of therapeutic agents and cancer that is increasing in scope or severity as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Histologic Confirmation Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma EGFR Activating Mutation Prior Therapeutic Procedure Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._Having been established or verified._A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy._A somatic mutation of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene which encodes a 170kDa transmembrane protein, a short transmembrane region, and an intracellular domain._Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Histologic Confirmation Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma EGFR Activating Mutation Prior Therapeutic Procedure Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.:Having been established or verified.:A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.:A somatic mutation of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene which encodes a 170kDa transmembrane protein, a short transmembrane region, and an intracellular domain.:Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including non-small cell squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma. Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.
A somatic mutation of the epidermal growth factor receptor gene which encodes a constitutively active 170kDa transmembrane protein, a short transmembrane region, and an intracellular domain.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does NSCLC harbor an EGFR activating mutation (Exon 21 L858R, Exon 19 deletion, Exon 18 G719X, Exon 21 L861Q)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have metastatic/
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic/recurrent, histologically confirmed NSCLC that harbors an EGFR activating mutation (Exon 21 L858R, Exon 19 deletion, Exon 18 G719X, Exon 21 L861Q) with progressive disease by RECIST 1.1 on a previous EGFR-TKI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does NSCLC harbor at least one of the following EGFR activating mutations: Exon 21 L858R, Exon 19 deletion, Exon 18 G719X, Exon 21 L861?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does NSCLC harbor at least one of the following EGFR activating mutations: Exon 21 L858R, Exon 19 deletion, Exon 18 G719X, Exon 21 L861Q or if patient is registered in EGFR Exon 20 expansion cohort D, does NSCLC harbor an EGFR Exon 20 insertion performed by a CLIA certified test?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: NSCLC harbor at least one of the following EGFR activating mutations: Exon 21 L858R, Exon 19 deletion, Exon 18 G719X, Exon 21 L861Q or if patient is registered in EGFR Exon 20 expansion cohort D, does NSCLC harbor an EGFR Exon 20 insertion performed by a CLIA certified test?
